Fields.DialogueText: You're sure about that? I see. Thank you, Osono, that will... oh! Kanchou! Good timing.
You've upped your spy game again if you're using radios now. Where the heck is Osono, though?
Where I need her to be, of course. She'll return soon. This business was too important to trust to anyone else.
What business would that be?
I'll tell you as soon as I finish the analysis. In the meantime... I have another puzzle.
One I suspect you can help me with.
Why did Koku think he could possibly get away with what he was doing aboard me?

Fields.MenuText: The Army doesn't believe Belles exist. Or at least they don't understand you.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes... but perhaps this particular problem long predates our awakening.

Fields.MenuText: Someone was obviously feeding Koku some sort of narrative.

Fields.DialogueText: But to what end?

Fields.MenuText: Are the interservice rivalry games always this bad in Japan?

Fields.DialogueText: No, sometimes they get downright unpleasant.
Hmm. I need Osono's report. We haven't seen the last of this mess, that much is certain.
I... Kuso!
What?
Enemy ships inbound!
Get those planes in the air and get the escorts dancing!
@BATTLE
No quarter! Engage by squadrons!
@BATTLE
You look troubled. Something in Osono's report?
I simply find it disconcerting when someone doubts my existence, Kanchou.
The Imperial Army actually doubts the existence of Belles? Really?
To an extent, they believe ships have spirits, like any good Shintoist... and they'll obey the Imperial will.
But they can't help but feel Belles are extremely convenient for the Navy?
Precisely.

Fields.MenuText: Why do I feel like this is going to end up being a problem?
Honestly, I have a hard time believing a woman as beautiful as you could exist too.
Fighting a global land war between dozens of nations while facing an existential threat. Charming.

Fields.DialogueText: Because it almost certainly is, and an experienced officer should have a nose for that sort of thing.
Yamenasai Kanchou! It's not nice to tease ladies, you know!
It is, unfortunately, human nature.
Mhmm. And it's human nature that makes me think something is coming.
I'm sure you're right. Koku was a test, I think. Someone has learned from his failure.
Mhmm. My nose also tells me something worse is coming.
Is it teasing if it's sincere, though?
Anyway. I don't think this is over.
We'll just have to be ready for whatever they throw at us next.
Well, we have the first results of Koku's mischief, Kanchou.
A message from Kaigun-daisa Fukudo Keiji. Intelligence has verified him.
The Navy Ministry wants to make an actual inspection of the ship, and observe Belle carrier flight operations.

Fields.MenuText: I'm inclined to refuse. Koku had official paperwork too.
Maybe it's a legit inspection.
Hmm. Well, at least we'll know where the snake is once they're here.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't have the legal right to refuse, especially to a commissioned officer on active service.
And maybe I'm a delusional beauty who's merely obsessed enough with Kanchou to pretend to be flagship.
My thoughts exactly.
We'll need to prepare to deal with whatever their game is.
If there's a game to be played at all.
No, there's a game. There has to be. The ministry already looks poorly because of Koku.
They would not send another minion out so quickly without some underlying plan.
*ALARM*
One wishes the enemy would learn similar restraint.
@BATTLE
That's a lovely melody.
Ah, Kanchou - sumimasen! Did my playing disturb you?
Just the opposite, I found your songs refreshing.
Your praise honors me. I do love the shamisen - such a simple instrument, but with incredible potential in the right hands.
Playing makes me think of you, actually.

Fields.MenuText: Because I'm simple with incredible potential?
More than the sum of our parts - like a married couple, perhaps.
I see what you mean.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! Don't tease me by saying such things. I was being serious.
Kanchou, you can't just...! My heart isn't ready for such flirting.
I thought you might.
You should play more often - it’s soothing. I’m sure the crew appreciates it too.
And, most important of all, it pleases me. Which is reason enough for any form of art to be practiced.
Well said. From the sword, to music or painting. It must do something for the one doing.
Unfortunately, I fear we shall have to continue this impromptu concert later.
We have enemy ships cresting the horizon. One of my retainers just spotted them.
Right, battle stations!
@BATTLE
I swear, the enemy are specifically primed to ruin any opportunity I have to relax!
Sounds like an excellent opportunity to let off a little steam, then.
By your order, Kanchou! Sei bai!
@BATTLE
I am singularly frustrated, Kanchou. Osono is too. Deadlocked at every turn.
So far all she's managed to dig up back in Tokyo involves a battleship construction project.
Japan is building new battleships?
Yes, I believe there's a planned class of four... They're like nothing the world has ever seen before.
They're massive beyond all previous sensible scales.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like they're prefect for mauling Vanity and her ilk.
I would've thought Admiral Yamamoto would have had choice words about such things.
Outdated relics. We'll have to show the world what naval air power can really do.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to brawl like thugs in the street, I suppose.
Oh, he did. He was overruled by the old fossils, it seems.
By your will, Kanchou.
Still, what could it possibly have to do with us?
Osono is returning soon? Maybe she'll have news she didn't feel comfortable transmitting.
Yes... Still. I'm very troubled by all this... we'll just have to piece it all together.
Kanchou? A word, if you please?
Of course, Akagi - close the hatch, take a seat. I always have time for you.
Gozaimasu. I have Osono's report. You were right. There was more.
We now know what this alleged inspection is for. To gather data to order a new class of carriers.
Interesting... and who's this Fukudo, then?
That's the interesting part. He's very much a real naval officer. He's spent his career in procurement and large surface combatants.
A battle wagon type, eh?

Fields.MenuText: Why would they send a battleship driver on a carrier research task?
Those new carriers not good enough for the combined fleet?
Curious... all sounds reasonable, and yet...

Fields.DialogueText: Theoretically any skilled procurement officer or naval engineer would do. In practice...
They are not even commissioned yet, Kanchou. But I can't imagine they won't be acceptable at least.
I feel it too. Something is very wrong here.
When does Fukudo arrive?
It should be tomorrow.
Then there's nothing for us to do now besides see what happens.
Well, not entirely nothing. Could I tempt you with some tea and sweets?
Yes, I think you could.
*ALARM*
Seems we have guests with different recreational ideas in mind.
Then let us go out and greet them properly.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Kami-sama! Enemy raiders!
Blast and damn, the small craft carrying Fukudo is still out there!
Launch a strike package! No dignitaries are going to die on our watch!
@BATTLE
I suppose I must thank you for that timely rescue. Kanchou, Kami-sama.
It was our pleasure - right, Akagi?
We're just glad no harm came to you or your staff.
Yes, of course. You're a credit to the Imperial Navy, Kami-sama, and you an able guardian, Kanchou.
Excitement aside, I'd like to get my staff settled and get to work immediately.
Of course! Osono, if you'd show them where we have their billets.
Hai, Kami-sama. Kaigun-daisa, tadotte kudasai.
He seems perfectly normal. Perhaps I'm being paranoid...

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, your beauty distracted me from noticing anything.
Perhaps. I'll withhold judgement for now.
Make sure Osono investigates thoroughly.

Fields.DialogueText: You're such a tease, Kanchou!
Wise as always, Kanchou.
She will. Of that we can be entirely certain.
Come, let's have a little tea. Then check on our guests.
Sounds delightful - lead on.
Kanchou! Gotcha!
Akagi! Get off!
Don't you like being wrapped in my thorns, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: It's not about if I like it or not.
Yes.
What? Thorns?

Fields.DialogueText: What is it about, then?
Mrrf. Just coming out and saying it like that! So dominant!
You know, my thorns. The talons I've dug into you.
I'm more worried about what other people might think if they see us.
Worrying about what that bastard Koku said now?
He might be a bastard, but that doesn't mean he's wrong. I don't want to have to kill someone to defend your honor over a misunderstanding.
Kanchou! That's my line! You're supposed to stay back and let me handle the dangerous part.
Doesn't mean I can't duel on your behalf with human opponents.
Keep that up and I might just have to swoon into your arms... then sweep you off your feet.
Doesn't that usually go the other way around?
Never underestimate a Belle, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
And never underestimate a Morgana's capacity to ruin my fun!
@BATTLE
It's entirely inappropriate! How dare you disgrace yourself and His Majesty like this!
...That doesn't sound good. Why is there shouting in my office, Osono?
Sounds like Kami-sama is having a disagreement with Fukudo-san. You may want to intervene.
Do I really?
*sigh*
Fine. I'm going. Stay nearby Osono. Just in case.
And that-
What's the meaning of all this racket? They can hear you shouting down in engineering!
Fukudo-san has alleged that our relationship is inappropriate, Kanchou.
Because it is! You take far too many liberties with a warship of the Japanese navy.
Never mind an unmarried woman!
This entire ship is a mess in that regard, a mixed gender crew? Absolute madness.

Fields.MenuText: A captain is supposed to be married to the ship. Metaphorically anyway. I'd have thought you'd understand that, Fukudo.
It's pure necessity. The land war takes incredible volumes of men, after all.
You've well and truly overstepped the bounds of your investigation, Captain.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps he's not commanded at sea properly. Else he'd have a Belle of his own.
Plus, fighting the Morgana can be considered suicidal in some cases. We need every body we can get.
I'll say.
Besides, it doesn't matter what you think captain. Kanchou is my master and commander, and not even the will of the Tenno can change that.
Nor can they easily undo this...
A marriage registration?
A wha...!? I mean! Akagi! You can't just show people that!
I can and I will. Frankly, I think Fukudo-san is right. It's completely improper for me to not attend to my duties as your wife.
I'll move my things into our quarters immediately.
She can't be serious about this! What nonsense is this, Captain?
*ALARM*
For once their timing is actually useful.
@BATTLE
Akagi, get a flight of bombers into the air!
Fly, my pretties! Fly!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, okaerinasai! Can I offer you dinner? A bath? Or perhaps...
Akagi... what in the world are you doing?
My duties as your wife, of course. I told you I was moving in. I even have the appropriate paperwork.
That I don't remember signing at all.
You did actually sign that one. After about thirty signatures you stop actually reading what you're signing.
Thank you for noting that security vulnerability.
So you're serious about this whole thing while Fukudo is here?
Very much so.

Fields.MenuText: Huh.
You know there's... not a lot of legal precedent for a marriage like that.
You know it wouldn't hold up in court, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Its unexpectedness is a strength, Kanchou.
But does he know it? And would a court dare to tell a kami what she could and could not do?
It's the easiest way to disarm his attack.

Fields.MenuText: What attack is he making?
Ah, I see. By accusing us of impropriety...
I'd rather we be moving in together for the right reasons rather than just dealing with Fukudo.

Fields.DialogueText: He's discrediting us, of course.
Yes, precisely, he plans to use our relationship for political leverage. Why... I'm not sure.
Kanchou! Always on the attack, aren't you?
I have Osono working hard to figure out what's going on.
Fukudo's team has spread out and are taking detailed notes. Osono will steal us a copy soon, hopefully.
Any wild guesses?
Hmm. I'm going to write this down. There. Folded... wax... and sealed. Keep that in your pocket.
What is it?
My prediction. Open it when I tell you to, and my foolishness or genius will be proven.
Well, I think I've figured part of it out.
Of what specifically, Kanchou?
Of whatever's going on. On a hunch I asked signals and Osono to keep an ear out.
Just like Koku. IJA pattern encrypted radio transmissions during odd hours of the day.
These codes are much stronger. Possibly even current.
Which would likely make Fukudo an agent of the Kempeitai.
Yes, almost certainly.
The question remains however, what are they up to?

Fields.MenuText: Beyond digging up dirt on you and me, you mean?
Hmm. Has Osono stolen any of the notes being taken by Fuduko's people?
Always wheels within wheels with these people.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, though I think the two are connected.
No, that's an excellent idea, Kanchou!
Wouldn't want you to get bored, Kanchou.
Osono. Next time we enter combat, I want you to "borrow" some of the notes being taken.
Of course, mistress. I'll be sure to get as much as I can.
*ALARM*
Seems we've an opportunity. Akagi, let's get to the bridge.
Hai! Osono-chan, you know what to do.
@BATTLE
Danna-sama, I brought some tea and a few tea cakes to share.
I'm still not used to you using "sama" in how you address me.
True, normally I use no honorifics at all, which is far more familiar.
It is amusing that you focus on specifically the honorific, and not the overall title of spouse, however.
You look like you're having fun.
I think I am... "playing house," I think is what little girls the world over call it.
And I get much nicer toys to play house with.

Fields.MenuText: I'm less enthused about you kicking me out of my rack.
As long as you're having fun. Living with a beautiful woman is barely a hardship.
Well, we basically spent every waking moment together anyway. Not like much has changed.

Fields.DialogueText: I did no such thing! You graciously volunteered!
I am having fun, and I appreciate the compliment.
More than every waking moment. Sometimes I'd watch you sleep.
What?
What?
I wonder if we've fooled the enemy completely? Next time we're on the bridge, offer me your arm.
I have to wonder just how much of this is you playing, Akagi.
Does Kanchou suspect me of harboring feelings for my respected commanding officer?
Just a little.
I wonder what the truth might be.
*ALARM*
Well, then - I believe you wanted me to take your arm. Shall we?
Yes, Danna-sama, I do believe we shall.
@BATTLE
Danna-sama, your tea...
Tea... and a report from Osono?
Yes, she's catalogued Fukudo's movements in detail on the ship.
Like many military men, he is a creature of habit; he also responds predictably to certain stimuli.
For example, seeing us be in some way affectionate, such as when I take your arm, annoys him greatly.
Or, if certain kinds of sake are offered in the officer's mess, he tends to stay longer by at least an hour.
Even something as simple as Fukudo's schedule represents a great opportunity if used properly.

Fields.MenuText: I feel like Osono must have been dreadfully bored ferreting all that out.
That's all very fascinating. Tell me more about Fuduko's boring existence.
I think that's exactly the kind of information we needed.

Fields.DialogueText: Danna-sama, patience is the greatest weapon of the shinobi.
Oh, you! This type of thing is critical for spies to analyze targets and probe them for weaknesses.
I agree completely.
With this in hand we can begin active intelligence gathering.
How should we start?
I believe we shall start by getting Fukudo very, very angry.
*ALARM*
Speaking of anger...
I suppose that tea will have to wait!
@BATTLE
Thank you for joining me in my little garden, Danna-sama.
You don't need to thank me for that, Akagi. I didn't know you grew roses! They're gorgeous.
It must take incredible skill to grow roses with so much salt water around.
Just care and patience. Danna-sama, here, let me just... there. A little red to brighten your uniform.
And a kiss on the cheek to keep harpies away from you... and annoy one of Fukudo's people.
Look deep into my eyes as we talk so we can be extra-infuriating.
He ran off. Must be going to report.

Fields.MenuText: This has to be too much fun for what amounts to counter-espionage activity.
Careful with being so sweet to me, Akagi. I might come to adore you for real.
All these flowers and you're the prettiest thing in sight.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm told you should enjoy what you do.
One can hunt two different types of game on the same trip, Danna-sama.
If you make me swoon like a damsel in a Western film, you had best catch me, Kanchou. Or else.
By the way, why roses?
Ah, I love roses. Red is my favorite color... but it's the vines I feel special kinship to.
Able to cling, grow and develop in places of great adversity and produce something beautiful.
While being quite capable of defending itself with its thorns.
Precisely, Danna-sama. You already understand me so well! I...
*ALARM*
Someone is going to pay very dearly for this interruption.
... Akagi, I'm not sure I've seen you this angry before. What's...
No time. We have scum to slaughter!
@BATTLE
Targets sighted. Heading for a convoy just like we expected. All ships. Engage per the plan.
Belles acknowledged.
Ship's officers acknowledge!
Good. Let's give our guests a rude awakening.
@BATTLE
Here, Danna-sama, you need to freshen up after a long engagement.
Thank you, darling - that's exactly what I needed.
Osono-chan is bringing tea for the rest of you to enjoy. A relief watch will take over soon after.
You're still on duty until then, so no slacking off. We might have a submarine lurking around.
... Fukudo's spy just left the port lookout platform.

Fields.MenuText: Think he saw us?
Just as planned...
I think we're putting on too good a show. The crew is starting to call us "Oto-san" and "Oka-san."

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yes - he most definitely did.
Show people what they want to see, and they take it. Unless they're extremely paranoid.
I can think of worse things than to be the subject of parental affection from the crew.
Osono reports that she's made some headwind creating rumors and the like as well.
I suspect things will come to a head with Fukudo imminently.
Whatever his game, this little "impropriety" is like waving fresh meat before a hungry dog.
He's not a terribly good spy, is he?
He's just a naval officer doing what he thinks is his duty... and selfishly advancing his own interests along the way.
Or so I suspect, anyway.
Well, let's get him locked down and burned soon. We have enough external threats.
Most definitely agreed, Kanchou.
Kanchou, I maintain that this is an outrage! Treating a flagship of the Imperial Japanese Navy like a housewife!
Akagi chose to act as she does because it pleases her.
If you think you can compel her to change against her will, then tell me so I can clear the blast radius when you try.
Both of you are simply impossible to deal with! All of this is going in my report to the ministry!
He seemed a touch upset. Kusotare.
Mind your language, darling.
Of course, Danna-sama. What example might I set for the children if I use such foul speech?

Fields.MenuText: Is that what we're calling the crew now?
Can you even have children?
He's taking the bait.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps it's best if we leave it unclear.
I... I'm not sure. I thought someone once said that HMS Victory had a child.
Hook, line, and sinker, as the Yankees say.
So, did you search his cabin?
And his staff's cabins. As expected, two secret radios, some code books hidden in luggage liners, and so on.
They are taking extensive and detailed notes - but to what end I'm simply not sure.
Did the codebooks give any hint as to whose operation this is?
Yes and no... They're Japanese Army, but not the usual code books, to my knowledge.
I can only assume that Captain Fukudo is working for or with the Kempeitai.
I also confirmed that Fukudo is a hardcore ultranationalist.

Fields.MenuText: Again as expected.
All the more reason he'd be appalled by our "marriage."
You do good work.

Fields.DialogueText: I-
*ALARM*
... Have to get to the bridge!
@BATTLE
Enemy ships sighted, air group, search and destroy! No quarter! Sei bai!
@BATTLE
So I have recovered some more documents from Fukudo's quarters, and from his staff.
They mostly concern those battleships we discussed, the design A-140F6 ships.
What little I found on carriers was quite dismissive of naval air power as a weapon of war.

Fields.MenuText: Old-timers nattering. They're fumbling in ignorance.
Like most children, they're easily impressed by the biggest, the most heavily armored. Planes can't give them that same feeling of awe.
Seems like Japan wants to win the last war.

Fields.DialogueText: Their fumbling will cost lives, but they see only their ambitions.
More fools them. My retainers can do more than their precious, archaic battleships ever could.
Not everyone can see forward clearly like Admiral Yamamoto, it seems.
I think we're starting to nail this problem down, Kanchou.
I agree. Expand your research. I'm curious about the notes they're taking on the carriers.
I also want to know if there are any collaborators in the crew.
Then I shall send Osono to hunt spies, and make another visit to Fuduko's quarters.
We can draw him out quite successfully with the right bait, it seems.
Kanchou?
Ah, Akagi, good timing. I was just reviewing these documents...
These reports Osono recovered. Is it just me, or are all of these numbers fatally flawed?
Excellent eye, Kanchou. Yes. Measurements are mostly accurate, but they have my blueprints.
Crew resources, aircraft handling methods, all of these are wrong.
All of it's formulated as if proposing a new carrier design, but it's been skewed.

Fields.MenuText: Hmm. Utter madness. I can't figure out what they're up to.
Look here, they even have the island configured to port in their proposal!
Why sabotage your own ships?

Fields.DialogueText: They're rabid dogs, clearly... but there's a plan here, not just madness.
Savages. Surely the Navy Ministry would know better... but presented as fresh war time analysis...
I think I know, but I won't celebrate just yet. Not until we have Fukudo in the brig.
This is getting more dangerous.
This could have serious knock-on effects. Both on the conventional war, and our war.
Don't these idiots know this could damage the INPF? What are they going to do when the Morganas kill us all?
I would have thought my countrymen would be more aware of the threat.
After all, our entire home island chain is under the guns of the Funayūrei. Nowhere is safe.
*ALARM*
Not even here, it seems.
Especially not here. I swear these hags are stalking you specifically.
Is that jealousy in your tone, Akagi?
Of course. You're my Kanchou. The sea hags can have armor-piercing bombs instead.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Transmission from a small boat nearby, it's announcing itself as commanding admiral, INPF-Japan!
By all means, bring the admiral aboard, and quickly!
The admiral is here? Now?!
Why so concerned, Captain Fukudo? The admiral might even want to offer you a job.
I must... go prepare my report.
Hm.

Fields.MenuText: He ran off faster than I expected.
Seems the game is afoot.
Did you arrange for this surprise visit?

Fields.DialogueText: He's quite fast when he wants to be, it seems.
Indeed. I'm still not sure what the game is, however.
No, not directly anyway. I'm as surprised as everyone else. I just made a report.
The admiral is aboard!
Excellent, let's...
Morgana raiders, they're closing fast!
Must've been laying in wait nearby. Get the admiral below - battle stations!
@BATTLE
Come on! Let's put on a good show for the admiral! Engage!
@BATTLE
Thank you for joining me, Akagi no Kami, captains.
Of course, Admiral. We're honored to have you aboard.
What brings you to our humble flotilla?
Captain Fukudo, actually. I've found your reports most fascinating. More social gossip than technical data.
And the technical data and information you've sent is wrong.
What? This is an outrageous accusation, Admiral!
Considering I have accurate technical notes thanks to Akagi-sama, it's not outrageous. Merely accurate.
And with the tip off we've received, we know who else you're sending these reports to.
I didn't expect him to dash off quite that dramatically.
Osono! Sei bai!
With pleasure, Kami-sama.

Fields.MenuText: So who was he a spy for, anyway?
I'm sure the Kempeitai won't be pleased about this.
I'm not sure why he thinks there's anywhere to run...

Fields.DialogueText: More who he *wasn't* a spy for, Kanchou.
No, they won't. Not in the slightest.
Most rodents will always at least try to flee, even backed into a corner.
The letter you sent was most concerning, Akagi-sama - and accurate, per ONI.
Open my prediction, Kanchou?
"Fukudo is attempting to sabotage the next generation of the Japanese carrier program in the name of more battleship funding."
Exactly correct - more specifically, money and resources for the second pair of Yamato class ships.
And for the design A-150 ships, which will theoretically be the successors to the Yamato class.
Now... I also have a private matter to discuss with both of you, when you have time.
Tea, Admiral?
I have a freshly delivered sencha from Tsuen tea house in Kyoto.
Yes, I'll take a cup - my compliments on the selection.
Now... about your living together, Kanchou, Kami-sama.
As I told Fukudo, we are lawfully married...
Your marriage is a sham - with all due respect, Kami-sama.
I understand you needed to play your game to deal with Fukudo. But I must ask you to take this more seriously.
Because it's improper?
I did not say that, Kami-sama - though it is improper.
But why? It doesn't violate any regulation I've ever heard of. Or any law.
It doesn't, nor do I wish to stop you. I am simply saying that you must go about it in the proper way

Fields.MenuText: Well, we don't actually have a relationship like that Admiral.
Proper as in a full courtship, wedding, and so on?
What way is that?

Fields.DialogueText: Nonsense. You're more intimate and in tune with each other than many married couples.
Precisely.
Simply that certain things must be accounted for and observed.

Fields.MenuText: Hm.
It can't have escaped your notice that I'm not Japanese.
You don't think my gender is going to be an issue there?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not my place to second-guess the preferences of a kami. Whatever the complications may be, it falls to us to make this help the war effort rather than undermine it - and so we must be proactive.
Surely you understand that such an auspicious event as the marriage of an international hero and a Kami of the Fleet would draw attention?
Especially one of our own capital ships. And while he is not your father...
I imagine the Emperor would want to at least give his blessing.
I... Uhm. Yes. I'm sure His Majesty would want to. Maybe even attend. I swear it's getting a bit warm in here. Kanchou? What should we do?
Do as you will - but now that Fukudo is dealt with, take your relationship, if one exists, with due seriousness and propriety.
And take your time. Don't let anything rush either of you into anything.
Yes. I see. Ah. Excuse me.
Wait! Akagi! Excuse me, Admiral.
Let her go for now, Kanchou. She needs a moment to think.
And so, in fact, do you. It's not often someone ambushes either of you, I'd wager.
Certainly not in my own quarters.
I'm sure Akagi will ensure your life is never boring.
Almost sounds like you're a Belle captain yourself.
No, just a married man who's been trying to keep up with his wife for decades.
I'll be departing shortly, Kanchou. Take good care of Akagi. We need you both.
You’re a bit quiet today.
Oh! Kanchou! Sumimasen - I was lost in thought.
Any thoughts in particular?
A mix... I was just watching the waves. The ocean’s always been beautiful to me, watching it ebb and flow, even as I move with it.
I was also thinking about our conversation with the admiral.

Fields.MenuText: About ending our somewhat fictional relationship?
I noticed you’d moved your things out again.
I did feel a bit like I was being lectured by a pretty girl’s stern father...

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. That, and other things.
I didn’t want to be a further burden, to you or to my country.
I suppose it did come off like that a bit, didn’t it?
I don’t know, Kanchou... playing house was fun, but taking things seriously...
I worry that I can’t be the person you need me to be.
That I won’t... maybe it’s just better to forget the whole thing. For both our sakes.
Well, hold on - that doesn’t sound like you, Akagi. I-
*ALARM*
I swear to whatever convenient deity will listen I’m sinking these bastards if I have to get into a motor launch with my service pistol to do it.
... I admit, I actually almost want to see you do it. The enemy certainly wouldn’t be expecting that!
Well, let’s just settle for old reliable: driving a spread of torpedoes into their hulls and raining bombs to send them back to hell for some R&R.
You’re always so considerate, Kanchou, even to the enemy.
@BATTLE
It was a pleasure having you aboard, Admiral.
The pleasure was mine, I assure you.
Where did Fukudo get off to?
I arranged with your security detail to lower him by crane in a crate. To spare him the indignity of being escorted off myself.
Hah! I'm sure he will appreciate your consideration.
Well, then - we'll be on our way. Quite the send-off you've arranged, though.
Makes an old admiral feel respected indeed.
Kiotsuke! Seirei!
You've a motley crew here, Kanchou, the most unique to sail under the flag of the rising sun.
But damned if they don't know how to salute properly.
Yasume! Shuppatsu! Dismissed.
Nicely done. I think the crew put on a good show considering half of them don’t speak nihongo.

Fields.MenuText: It was drilling them out of view of the admiral that was the hard part.
Drill and ceremonies take up far too much of our time.
We have to look sharp. It inspires discipline and confidence in the sailors.

Fields.DialogueText: Osono did excellent work in that regard.
Such things are good for cultivating a warrior's spirit, Kanchou. You'd do well not to dismiss them casually.
My thoughts exactly. The Admiral's compliment will only help morale further.
Excuse me. I have something I need to handle.
Hmm. I think Akagi might be avoiding me...
*ALARM*
Or maybe it's just the usual.
@BATTLE
No quarter! Sink them all!
@BATTLE
Akagi? Damn.
No immediate Akagi appearing out of nowhere... she really is dodging me.
Osono, a moment of your time, please.
Kanchou, how did you know?
Because I’m the captain - it’s just what I do. Come out, please.
Is that today's disguise, then? Well done, it’s seamless. Now. Tell me where Akagi is, please.
Kanchou, I'm not sure if I should...
I will track her down eventually, you know.
I know. Kanchou... how do you feel about Akagi-sama?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure how I feel about her completely, but I care about her.
This isn't about my feelings; it's about Akagi's.
I care about her deeply. I'm a bit hurt she's avoiding me.

Fields.DialogueText: She cares about you as well.
No, Kanchou, it's very much about you as well.
Well, I have positive news in that regard, at least.
Akagi-sama is confused about her own emotions at the moment.
She is also still fatalistic... as you know, she believes she will not survive the war.
Not if I have anything to say about it.
Hai, and she appreciates that as well. She's conflicted. Torn. The heart wants what it wants.
Her heart wants your love... but is scared of dragging you down to your death with her.
You will have to find her, and convince her to be brave enough to hope, Kanchou.
To live. Not just stoically await death.
You're still not going to tell me where she is, are you?
Trust yourself, Kanchou. You know where she is.
... The rose garden. Right. Thanks, Osono!
Kanchou... would you like to help me with the roses?
Yes, I think I'd enjoy that.
I thought I might find you out here with your roses.
You do know me well. Is... this really okay?
Is what okay? You having a garden? Fukudo being dragged off in chains? Or about us?
You know which. I... it was originally just to frustrate and defeat Fukudo, but being in such close quarters with you...
It... awakened something in me. I became far more aware of you in the way of a maiden.
Then I found it... A little bud of love I didn't know I was nursing. It scares me a bit.

Fields.MenuText: Why does it scare you?
Strong emotions can scare anyone.
I feel the same way about you.

Fields.DialogueText: Because I will not live to see the end of this war. I'm afraid loving me will mean you won't either.
I... yes. Especially when they're new to you.
I understand if you don't...wait. You do? Well. Of course you do! Right.
Let's start over again? I adore you Akagi. I want to romance you. Fall in love with you.
Even if we only have a little time left in this world, or a thousand years.
Neither would be as much fun without you by my side.
So let's give it a try. For real this time.
I... uhm. O-okay. If you're certain. Yoroshiku onegaishimasu.
I'll be in your care too. Though I suppose we already are in each other's care.
True. It's a bit silly of a phrase when we've been in countless battles together.
Funny how any time I go for a stroll on the deck there's something out there to ruin the view...
@BATTLE
